ai.summary: Eden Valley Walk is a long-distance, hard-rated hike in the United Kingdom, covering 74.5 km. The route presents a challenging mix of hills, rough tracks, and varied terrain, best tackled by experienced hikers over multiple days.
ai.terrain_summary: The route traverses variable UK countryside with a mix of rural tracks, fields and potentially muddy or uneven surfaces. Expect short climbs and long, steady sections; plan for 2-4 days depending on pace.
ai.safety_notes: This is a demanding, long-distance hike. Prepare with proper navigation skills (map and compass or GPS) and a clear itinerary. Check the forecast and be prepared for rapid weather changes common in the UK. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and layered clothing; carry a waterproof outer layer. Bring sufficient water and high-energy food, plus a basic first aid kit. Inform someone of your planned route and estimated finish time. Carry a charged mobile device and a means of emergency communication; know when to turn back if conditions or fatigue worsen.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof, breathable shell
Backpack (20-40 L) with a water-resistant cover
Map and compass or GPS device with offline maps
Water bottles or hydration bladder (2-3 L total)
Headlamp or torch with extra batteries
Basic first aid kit and emergency whistle
Rain cover for gear and dry bags
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March–October); winter conditions can be severe and should only be attempted by experienced hikers.

seo.title: Eden Valley Walk: 74.5 km Hard UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Eden Valley Walk, a demanding 74.5 km hike in the United Kingdom. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons to tackle this challenging route.
